page.title: 10LOWER HARDRES AREA-FARMS 1
page.content: { Northcourt Farmhouse}next to Lower Hardres Church was built in 1690 on the site of an earlier house.{Lower {Heppington's}Edwardian stables are part of a former estate. The Georgian house was demolished at the beginning of the 20th century. The clock tower with weather vane displaying a rampant white horse was used for target prac- tice by soldiers in the 1939-45 war. The holes can still be seen. {Nackington Farm}covers 700 acres of vegetables and fruit. The Company employs about 200 regular and casual staff. Students and mothers with young children take this opportunity to earn money picking and sorting. Staff facilities include transport to and from work, a rest room, kitchen and a creche. The public buy from the farm shop often in bulk to freeze or use the cheaper "Pick your own" method.
